old_regulations.summary: Requires registration and licensing of virtual asset service providers (VASPs), including exchanges and custodians. Mandates AML/CFT compliance, record-keeping, and cooperation with CIMA supervisory requirements.
Extends AML obligations to virtual asset service providers including customer due diligence, ongoing monitoring, and suspicious activity reporting to the Financial Reporting Authority.
CIMA policy guidance on supervisory approach to virtual assets, including risk-based supervision, governance standards, and technology risk management requirements for VASPs.

new_regulations.summary: Strengthens customer due diligence for VASPs with mandatory biometric verification for transactions over $10,000 KYD, enhanced screening against OFAC and UN sanctions lists, and real-time transaction monitoring. Introduces a 48-hour suspicious transaction reporting window to FRA.

amount_based: Transaction amount > 3× user's historical average (violates VASP Act AML thresholds)
Daily total amount > 2× user's usual daily total
Single transaction exceeding $10,000 KYD triggers mandatory biometric verification
Cumulative daily transaction volume between $9,000 and $9,999 KYD (potential structuring detection)
frequency_based: Transactions per day > 2× user's normal frequency
More than 10 transactions in a single day triggers CIMA review
location_based: Transaction from a new country not seen in history
Rapid country switching within short time (geo-hopping)
Real-time sanctions screening hit (UN/OFAC/UK lists) - Immediate Block
behavioural_pattern: Inconsistent behaviour vs declared profile (e.g., high volume from low-activity history)
Sudden change in transaction patterns suggesting layering
Smurfing pattern: Multiple sub-$10k transactions aggregating to >$10k within 24 hours

rules.rule: Impossible geo hop (actual time < min travel time)
